entries.content: Refreshed memory on our last streaming tool work. Found detailed delta memory from 2025-10-26 showing we fixed tool positioning by switching from re-rendering to incremental append. Key change: tools now inserted inside .stream-text container, chunks appended with +=. Markdown temporarily disabled. Multi-tab isolation issue discovered but still INCOMPLETE.

CRITICAL ARCHITECTURE DECISION from Moti:

On stream completion, we should:
1. Rename .stream-text to .stream-text-segment (preserving the completed content)
2. Create a NEW .stream-text element right above the indicator for the next stream

This creates a segmented approach where each turn gets its own segment, preventing text from different turns from mixing. This should solve the multi-tab isolation issue since each turn is in its own DOM segment.

Key insight: Instead of reusing one .stream-text container across all turns, we segment it. On completion: .stream-text → .stream-text-segment. On new stream: create fresh .stream-text above indicator. This architectural pattern provides clean turn isolation.

Starting implementation planning for stream segmentation architecture. Moti confirmed the approach: on completion rename .stream-text → .stream-text-segment, on new stream create fresh .stream-text above indicator.
